props.title: What is the primary purpose of a function?
props.question: Select the best description of why functions are used in programming:
options: To store data permanently in memory
To reuse code and organize logic into manageable blocks
To create visual elements on the screen
To perform operations only once per program
props.explanation: Functions allow developers to write reusable code blocks that perform specific tasks. This promotes code organization, reduces repetition, and makes programs easier to maintain and debug.

props.title: Understanding Tree Data Structures
props.question: Which of the following statements accurately describe a tree data structure?
options: A tree has a single root node and branches that extend downward
All nodes in a tree must have exactly two children
A tree can contain cycles between nodes
Trees are useful for representing hierarchical relationships
props.explanation: Trees are hierarchical structures with a root node and zero or more child nodes. Not all nodes need exactly two children (that's a binary tree), and trees cannot contain cycles. Trees excel at representing hierarchical data like file systems or organizational charts.
